name: 717 Armory
reviews: Visited on Black Friday. Wife didn't have drivers license with her, so they didn't let her shoot. Oh well, drove 100 miles and no shooting. She just went...

My friend and I had a BLAST we fired our 9mms, 380s, 45s and my 22 revolver, 

$20 per hr first shooter and $10 per hour for second shooter per range $2...

name: Enola Yard
reviews: This busy rail yard on the western bank of the Susquehanna is so busy, so secretive, and so top notch. It is amazing watching things coming and going...

This is the third or fourth time we've visited, and the exhibits are always good.  There's usually about five exhibits -- don't miss the ones in the vault...

reviews: HMAC, a sometimes sore topic of discussion for a plethora of reasons. You just have to remember one thing: this is Harrisburg. It's the best we have. It's...

name: West Hanover Winery
reviews:
One of our favorites, for sure!  

At first it seemed a little sketchy wandering through a garage-converted-winery. But wow, never judge a book! The staff...

name: Italian Lake
reviews: Stumble across this location . It's beautiful and peaceful . We've spent an hour just walking, talking and listening to the water. Some of the fountains...

Some great childhood memories of the lake bike rides when it was warm and skating when it was cold.  One of the things I miss about Harrisburg.

name: India Day

reviews: I really enjoy playing darts here and enjoying a Philly cheesesteak.  Erin is a great bartender and we love when she's working.

name: The Sturges Speakeasy
reviews:
It breaks my heart to write this review but I have to.

reviews:

name: Cassel Vineyards Of Hershey

name: Get Air Harrisburg
reviews: Unorganized chaos.. children running everywhere made it very difficult to jump and very unsafe.

I...

Great produce options, organic and non, meats, cheeses, baked goods, wine, and food trucks too! Love it!

name: New Cumberland Borough Park
reviews: A good small park. Great for trout fishing and also a great place for kids. My girlfriend and I come here for walks along the creek. A lot of open space

reviews:
The staff here is very nice and helpful. 
I teach a children's  art class on Saturday mornings. 

It is free to look at the art and classes are very reasonable!

name: Highspire Reservoir Park
reviews:
The park spans a little over a mile. Accessible by car from Whitehouse ln, or Ann st. Walking access is available from Hanover st.  

The trail is scenic,...
This is almost 2 miles but not looped. Lots of greenery. Good for photos. Does have a port o potty.  Not to bad as far as traffickers.

name: Popcorn Hat Players
reviews:
